page.title: 05AROUND WEETING
page.content: The farmland around the village is mixed, mostly sheep and a few cattle eastwards to the forest; arable to the west and north. The eastern area of the forest has the A1065 running through it and belongs to the Forestry Commission. There is a picnic site, Emily's Wood on the west side of the road. The arable land in the west fin- ishes with a narrow strip of heathland part of a large reserve owned by the Norfolk Nat. Trust, this being the home in particular of the Stone Curlew and other scarce Breckland features. It is wardened in the summer. The whole block is in Breckland and for further information on this and the F.C. please refer to 05800285.
